contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox VG | title = Rag Doll Kung Fu | image = [[Image:Rag Doll Kung Fu Coverart.png]] | developer = Qi Studios | publisher = {{vgrelease|NA=Merscom|EU=[[Zoo Digital Publishing]]}} | designer = [[Mark Healey]] | distributor = [[Steam (software)|Steam]] <small>(online)</small> | engine = | released = October 12, 2005 | genre = [[Fighting game]] | modes = [[Single player]], [[multiplayer]] | ratings = {{vgratings|PEGI=18+|ESRB=M}} | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]] | media = [[Digital distribution|Download]] | requirements = 800 MHz [[Pentium III|P3]], 256 MB [[RAM]], [[GeForce 2]] [[graphics card]] | input = [[Mouse (computing)|Mouse]], [[Gamepad]] }} '''''Rag Doll Kung Fu''''' is a [[Fighting game|fighting]] [[computer game]], created predominantly by artist [[Mark Healey]], while working for [[Lionhead Studios]], along with other Lionhead employees, such as David Smith and [[Alex Evans (video game developer)|Alex Evans]]. ''Rag Doll Kung Fu'' is available from [[Valve Software|Valve]]'s [[Steam (software)|Steam]] content delivery platform. A new version, called ''Rag Doll Kung Fu: Fists of Plastic'' was made available for download on the [[PlayStation Network]] for the [[PlayStation 3]] on 9 April 2009.<ref name=PSNRelease>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediamolecule.com/2009/03/12/rag-doll-kungfu/|title=Rag Doll Kung Fu|publisher=Media Molecule}}</ref> ==Gameplay== The game features string puppets that allow for complete control over their hands, arms, and the like. The game is written in [[C++]] and [[Direct3D]] though it is only played in two ([[2.5D|and a half]]) dimensions and exclusively with the mouse. RDKF uses multiple mice to implement multiplayer on a single machine, but this feature is limited to [[Windows XP]] due to the use of this [http://jstookey.com/arcade/rawmouse/ Raw input] code to implement this idea. An online multiplayer feature has been added to the game as well. ==Development== The project was first announced during an interview with Healey by LHTimes.<ref>http://www.lionhead.com/news</ref> In the interview, Healey explained that the game was started after he and a few friends made a £50 kung fu film, and Healey felt a game should go along with it. Healey created a site dedicated to ''Rag Doll Kung Fu'' on the [[Lionhead Studios|Lionhead]] server.<ref>http://www.ragdollkungfu.com</ref> In late 2005 [[Mark Healey]], David Smith and Alex Evans left [[Lionhead Studios]] to form [[Media Molecule]]. ''Rag Doll Kung Fu'' was nominated in the 2006 Develop awards for "New PC IP" and "Innovation". It has also been nominated in the [[GameShadow]] Innovation in Games Awards 2006 ==Rag Doll Kung Fu: Fists of Plastic== {{Infobox VG | title = Rag Doll Kung Fu: Fists of Plastic | image = [[Image:Rag Doll Kung Fu- Fists of Plastic PS Store North America icon.png]] | developer = [[Tarsier Studios]] | publisher = [[Sony Computer Entertainment]] | designer = Björn Sunesson | engine = | released = April 9, 2009<ref name=PSNRelease /> | genre = [[Fighting game]] | modes = [[Single player]], [[multiplayer]] | ratings = {{vgratings|ESRB=Everyone 10+|PEGI=12+}} | platforms = [[PlayStation 3]] | media = [[Digital distribution|Download]] | requirements = | input = [[Gamepad]] }} ''Rag Doll Kung Fu: Fists of Plastic'', based upon ''Rag Doll Kung Fu'', is a [[PlayStation Network|PSN]] exclusive downloadable game that was released for the [[PlayStation 3]] on 9 April 2009.<ref name="PSNRelease"/> The game was temporarily free in the US boosting sales for the game. It features new gameplay using the buttons of the PlayStation controller to make the character punch and kick. It also features "Chi Moves" like the Lighting ball or Meditation and a character designer.
